com.example.turist

Class EventsGps

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.example.turist.EventsGps
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultEventGPS, EventGps, EventGps, EventGps, EventGps, EventGps, EventGps, EventGps, EventGps

    public abstract class EventsGps
extends Activity
implements com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener
    EventGps is the abstract base class for all classes which allow confirmation of GPS position A EventGps object encapsulates the state information needed for the confirmation of reached position This state information includes:
    • The latitude of landmark
    • The longitude of Landmark
    • A distance from landmark
    • Photo from trip if there is any
    • Gps position of user

    Allow user to confirm visitation of a landmark after reaching the gps position which is nearby of this landmark (eg. 200 meters)

    Author:
    Peter Vrana

      • onClick

        public void onClick(View v)
        This method determines what to do when some button was clicked on screen If id of button equals:
        • R.id.button_gps - show dialog
        • R.id.btn_add - add new picture (start activity for result)
        • R.id.btn_remove - remove picture
        Parameters:
        v - - View

      • onCreateDialog

        protected Dialog onCreateDialog(int id)
        Setting up dialog it's buttons If button ok is pressed and place has not been visited and distance from this place is less than 200 meters visitation of the place will be confirmed. If any of conditions is false than message will be displayed. If button cancel will be pressed nothing happens.
        See Also:
        android.app.Activity#onCreateDialog(int, Bundle)
